results.headline: Review: ‘Mohenjo Daro’ Depicts a Go-To Hero’s Exertions in Antiquity
results.summary_short: Set in 2016 B.C., this Ashutosh Gowariker film is a standard epic adventure with music and romance.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mohenjo Daro

results.headline: Review: A Waltz Across Texas in ‘Hell or High Water’
results.summary_short: Brothers on a bank-robbing spree make their way through a desert of economic decline in this film by David Mackenzie.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hell or High Water

results.headline: Review: A Mission Against All Odds in the Wartime Thriller ‘Anthropoid’
results.summary_short: Cillian Murphy and Jamie Dornan star as Resistance fighters in Czechoslovakia who set out to assassinate one of the chief architects of the Holocaust.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Anthropoid

results.headline: Review: In ‘Joshy,’ Wedding’s Off, Bachelor Party’s a Go
results.summary_short: Written and directed by Jeff Baena, this comedy features Thomas Middleditch and Adam Pally, among others, enjoying a weekend of middle-class debauchery.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Joshy

results.headline: Review: In ‘My King,’ Blindly Falling Fast and Furious
results.summary_short: Told in flashback, this film follows the collision and decade-long duel between a guarded lawyer and an impulsively charismatic restaurateur.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of My King

results.headline: ‘Sausage Party’ Is an Animated Sex Comedy About Food ... and God
results.summary_short: In this free-spirited romp through the supermarket, potty-mouthed foodstuffs give voice to matters both humorous and spiritual.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sausage Party

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Model,’ She’s Camera Ready but Woefully Naïve
results.summary_short: Maria Palm stars in this film about high-fashion dreams and personal disappointments.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Model

results.headline: Review: ‘The Lost Arcade,’ a Love Letter to Old New York
results.summary_short: A bittersweet reminiscence of arcade days and nights in 1980s and ’90s New York.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Lost Arcade

results.headline: Review: In ‘Edge of Winter,’ an Unstable Dad With a Gun
results.summary_short: Underage driving and drinking, mental illness, firearms and jealousy in a hunting-trip thriller: What could go wrong?

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Edge of Winter

results.headline: Review: ‘Operation Chromite’ Revisits a Korean War Invasion
results.summary_short: John H. Lee’s drama concerns a squad of South Koreans who infiltrate North Korean forces and secure a lighthouse critical to the Battle of Inchon.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Operation Chromite

results.headline: Review: In ‘Pete’s Dragon,’ a Magical Bond in Peril Again
results.summary_short: This reboot from the director David Lowery tells its standard-issue story at a nice clip.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Pete's Dragon

results.headline: Review: Beyond the Politics in ‘Abortion: Stories Women Tell’
results.summary_short: Both sides are addressed in this documentary, which largely focuses on viewpoints and personal experiences in Missouri and Illinois.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Abortion: Stories Women Tell

results.headline: Review: In ‘Disorder,’ Danger Lurks in Many Corners, or None at All
results.summary_short: This movie from Alice Winocour follows a veteran returning to France from Central Asia who takes what seems to be a fairly straightforward security job.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Disorder

results.headline: Review: ‘Florence Foster Jenkins,’ Singing So Wretched It’s Legendary
results.summary_short: Meryl Streep stars in an enjoyable look back at a would-be singer and a Carnegie Hall concert remembered for how awful it was.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Florence Foster Jenkins

results.display_title: An Art That Nature Makes: The Work of Rosamond Purcell
results.headline: Review: ‘An Art That Nature Makes,’ an Illuminating Look at Rosamond Purcell
results.summary_short: In this documentary, Molly Bernstein invites us to see the world through the lens of her subject, Ms. Purcell, a photographer.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of An Art That Nature Makes: The Work of Rosamond Purcell

results.headline: Review: In ‘Nine Lives,’ a Man’s Life Is Like a Litter Box
results.summary_short: Kevin Spacey, Jennifer Garner and Christopher Walken star in a film about a distracted father who must turn into a cat to learn his lesson.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Nine Lives

results.headline: Review: In ‘Little Men,’ Boys Develop a Bond That Is Threatened by Money
results.summary_short: In an adventure story edged with unspoken risks, the young actors take the kind of chances that their more careful elders have been trained to avoid.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Little Men

results.headline: Review: Fanciful Classic ‘The Little Prince’ Is Turned Into Modernist Fable
results.summary_short: A gray corporate world rendered in computer graphics enfolds the stop-motion universe of Antoine de Saint-Exupéry’s tender tale.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Little Prince

results.headline: Review: Dim All the Lights, Again: ‘Will You Dance With Me?’
results.summary_short: Derek Jarman’s test footage shot at an East London disco is being shown as a short feature.

results.headline: Review: ‘Neither Heaven Nor Earth’ Engages the Horrors of War
results.summary_short: In Afghanistan, a captain of French NATO troops and a Taliban commander are forced into an unlikely alliance by a common, invisible enemy in this film.
